agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Pensions, Investments & Financial Services TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 25, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Jim Murphy The committee will meet to consider the following: HB 183 Stephenson | et al. Relating to a pension revenue enhancement plan for the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. HB 190 Bernal Relating to verification by a credit services organization of a consumer's ability to repay an extension of consumer credit. HB 210 Craddick | et al. Relating to the service retirement annuity for certain members of the Judicial Retirement System of Texas Plan Two. HB 874 Walle Relating to the threat or pursuit of criminal charges against a consumer in association with certain extensions of consumer credit. HB 1239 Parker Relating to a study by the Teacher Retirement System of Texas regarding the use of health reimbursement accounts in conjunction with certain Medicare plans to provide health benefit coverage for certain retired school employees. HB 2414 Cortez Relating to participation by certain state employees in a default investment product under a deferred compensation plan. HB 2567 Capriglione Relating to enrollment of certain retirees in the Texas Public School Employees Group Insurance Program. HB 2649 Flynn Relating to requiring the reporting of certain commissions and fees paid by public retirement systems. HB 3662 Walle Relating to the composition of the board of trustees of the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. HB 3951 Longoria Relating to the state salary for retired judges. HB 3983 Leach Relating to service retirement benefits payable by the Employees Retirement System of Texas to commissioned peace officers employed by the attorney general. HB 4086 Sanford Relating to the definition of "closing" for purposes of certain private activity bonds. HB 4343 Flynn Relating to increasing the maximum reference base amount for certain consumer loans. HB 4371 Stephenson Relating to digital currencies. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 4371 Bills deleted after last posting: HB 3125 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
